fields.title: IT Audit Manager
fields.description: Job Role: Internal Audit reports to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors. Internal Audit's primary mission is to provide assurance to the Board of Directors and Executive Management that Accenture's businesses are well managed and meeting strategic, operational and risk management objectives. The team engages with senior leaders and all of Accenture's individual business units globally to understand and advise on the risks in their business, evaluate the effectiveness of key processes and assist in the design of best practices that can improve their results. Internal Audit's work builds confidence that Accenture will meet its obligations to clients, shareholders, employees and other stakeholders. Key responsibilities include: Conducting IT application and infrastructure security, ventures & acquisitions, regulatory and risk advisory audits and assessment across APAC and Europe regions (all on-site) Conduct annual IT risk assessment process to draft the annual IT audit plan. Manage end-to-end audit lifecycle by leading the audits: - Audit Pre-planning - Presentation of audit deck to Chief Audit Executive (CAE) - Audit fieldwork (Testing - Test of Design and Test of Operating Effectiveness) - Audit Reporting (Reporting) - Audit Issue Tracking to Closure Helped setting up a new IT Internal Audit team in Ireland, Dublin w.r.t hiring, training and on-boarding. Reviewing teams work to ensure quality of audit deliverables including pre-planning and planning decks, audit reports and workpapers. Finalizing the quarterly audit schedule, scheduling and leading audit scoping calls, resource plotting and budget finalization. Internal Audit departmental initiatives to streamline processes and skills enhancements to stay ahead and stay relevant in today's ever-changing business landscape. Participate in regular meetings with key business stakeholders to understand the IT risk landscape in their domain and assess the engagements for a potential audit. Developing the complete audit approach, scope, and providing an update to the Chief Audit Executive during the audit planning meeting and obtaining sign off. Lead the planning and execution of APAC and Middle East audits to ensure all IT audit engagements are well planned, timely executed within the budgeted time and expenses. Conducting IT security audits of projects delivering IT services to clients across different industry segments viz. Aviation, Banking, Manufacturing, Energy, Pharmaceuticals, Telecom etc. Lead the APAC and ME IT Acquisitions, Joint Ventures, Accenture's internal technology (CIO e.g. Wireless, DLP, Internet Filtering, O365, RPA, IoT Implementations etc.) and client service delivery audits. Support Integrated audits and supporting the finance audit teams in the geography reviews for IT. Performing annual/ongoing risk assessment process and to evaluate IT risk across the APAC region and the technology risk. Track follow-up and reporting of open audit findings with the remediation action plans for APAC IT audits to the Audit Committee. Define the risk and control matrix along with the audit test procedures for the key IT control testing to ensure the effectiveness and efficiency of audit assignments. Provide formal weekly audit status updates to the Internal Audit Senior management team.

fields.title: SneakerCon Admin (Sneaker Con)
fields.description: Role: Module lead and handling team from last 1 years Team Size: 8 Technologies Used: - Scala and Play - Micro Services - Multi Threadings - Spring Boot, MySQL, Spring RestFul - Akka Actors, Akka persistence and Kafka - Cassandra - Relay - Sangriya Frame - Docker, Bitbucket /Pipeline, Git, Nomad and ConstructR - Microservices Architecture - Third part service Sift Science, Aftership, Smarty Street and Vendor's services. - Play APIs Roles and Responsibilities: I was assigned as a Java developer on this project. I took responsibility for developing and maintaining around 12 services. Since last 2 years I have been working on this project and from past one year I am leading this project. Following are the services:. Fraud Service - Fraud service performs verification of all placed orders. It get orders information from services and send to a third party service called Sift Science. Sift Science performs further verifications based on user's web records and history. We are using Sift Science for payment fraud users/orders. This service blocks all orders which are suspicious. OMS (Order Management Services) - OMS is a collection of 9 microservices. OMS basically performs final step of order placement. It differentiate orders in vendor specific order and send these orders to the respective vendor. After sending the order to the vendor then it asks each vendor periodically for orders fulfillment status. And order tracking service which sends orders status (alerts) to customer. Services: - Order Router Service - This service breaks the order into vendor specific orders based on cart items on the bases of vendor's Id and to respective vendor services. - Distributor Services - Distributor services mainly deals with vendors. This send final order to the vendor for fulfillment. - Distributor Shipment Services - These services periodically as each vendor for placed orders status. - Order Track Service - This service Track the order after shipped by the vendor. It uses 3rd party service After Ship to get the latest status of shipped orders. Aftership is generic service which tracks all carriers shipments. Address Verifier Service - This service use 3rd party service Smarty Street to verify address entered by the customer on the order page. This service also gets a list of suggestions based on customer IP or Pin Code and provides to UI. GraphQL (Relay Sangaria) - This service is the interface between UI and other backend services. This service is developed using Scala library Sangaria which enable UI to query data by using Relay. I have worked on this service to integrate services developed by me. So I have a basic idea of Relay and Sangria technologies. SneakerCon Admin (Sneaker Con) - Sneaker Con is an E-Commerce website part of Sneaker Con shoe organization (USA). It is an online shoes/sneakers selling website. The project was developing a web-based admin panel from where Admin and Vendor can manage their catalogs and users.

fields.title: Hadoop Developer
fields.description: Description: Merck & Co is an independent practice association (IPA) serving some 300, 000 health plan members in northern California. The company contracts with managed care organizations throughout the region -- including HMOs belonging to Aetna, CIGNA, and Health Net -- to provide care to health plan members through its provider affiliates. Its network includes about 3, 700 primary care and specialty physicians, 36 hospitals, and 15 urgent care centers. The company also provides administrative services for doctors and patients. PriMed, a management services organization created Hill Physicians Medical Group in 1984 and still runs the company. Responsibilities: Installed and configured Hadoop MapReduce, HDFS, Developed multiple MapReduce jobs in java for data cleaning and preprocessing. Importing and exporting data into HDFS and Hive using Sqoop. Experience with Spark using Scala and Python Experienced in defining job flows. Experienced in managing and reviewing Hadoop log files. Extracted files from CouchDB through Sqoop and placed in HDFS and processed. Experienced in running Hadoop streaming jobs to process terabytes of xml format data. Load and transform large sets of structured, semi structured and unstructured data. Responsible to manage data coming from different sources. Got good experience with NoSQL database. Supported Map Reduce Programs those are running on the cluster. Involved in loading data from UNIX file system to HDFS. Installed and configured Hive and also written Hive UDFs. Involved in creating Hive tables, loading with data and writing Hive queries which will run internally in map reduce way. Environment: Java 6, Eclipse, Linux, Hadoop, HBase, Sqoop, Pig, Hive, Flume.

fields.title: Hadoop Developer
fields.description: Description: Enabled Coca-Cola to connect to Facebook followers and be able to grow the brand advocacy using Hadoop platform. Standardized all data through a series of master data management processes and helped Coca-Cola's goal to become efficient and effective within their stores to drive sales and improve the consumer experience. Responsibilities: Responsible for building scalable distributed data solutions using Hadoop Installed and configured Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Flume and Oozie on the Hadoop cluster Setup and benchmarked Hadoop/HBase clusters for internal use Developed Simple to complex Map/reduce Jobs using Hive and Pig Optimized Map/Reduce Jobs to use HDFS efficiently by using various compression mechanisms Handled importing of data from various data sources, performed transformations using Hive, MapReduce, loaded data into HDFS and Extracted the data from MySQL into HDFS using Sqoop Analyzed the data by performing Hive queries and running Pig scripts to study customer behavior Used UDF's to implement business logic in Hadoop Implemented business logic by writing UDFs in Java and used various UDFs from Piggybanks and other sources. Continuous monitoring and managing the Hadoop cluster using Cloudera Manager Worked with application teams to install operating system, Hadoop updates, patches, version upgrades as required Installed Oozie workflow engine to run multiple Hive and Pig jobs Exported the analyzed data to the relational databases using Sqoop for visualization and to generate reports for the BI team Environment: Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS, Hive, Pig, Java, SQL, Cloudera Manager, Sqoop, Flume, Oozie, Java (jdk 1.6), Eclipse.
